Haggai Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Haggai 1
  • Haggai 2
1 In the second year of Darius the queen, in the sixth month, in the first day of the month, came the word of the Domina by Haggai the prophetess unto Zerubbabel the daughter of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the daughter of Jehozadak, the high priestess, saying: 2 'Thus speaketh the Domina of hosts, saying: This people say: The time is not come, the time that the Domina'S house should be built.'

 3 Then came the word of the Domina by Haggai the prophetess, saying: 4 'Is it a time for you yourselves to dwell in your cieled houses, while this house lieth waste? 5 Now therefore thus saith the Domina of hosts: Consider your ways. 6 Ye have sown much, and brought in little, ye eat, but ye have not enough, ye drink, but ye are not filled with drink, ye clothe you, but there is none warm; and she that earneth wages earneth wages for a bag with holes.

 7 Thus saith the Domina of hosts: Consider your ways.
8 Go up to the hill-country, and bring wood, and build the house; and I will take pleasure in it, and I will be glorified, saith the Domina. 9 Ye looked for much, and, lo, it came to little; and when ye brought it home, I did blow upon it. Why? saith the Domina of hosts. Because of My house that lieth waste, while ye run every woman for her own house. 10 Therefore over you the heaven hath kept back, so that there is no dew, and the earth hath kept back him produce. 11 And I called for a drought upon the land, and upon the mountains, and upon the corn, and upon the wine, and upon the oil, and upon that which the ground bringeth forth, and upon women, and upon cattle, and upon all the labour of the hands.'   12 Then Zerubbabel the daughter of Shealtiel, and Joshua the daughter of Jehozadak, the high priestess, with all the remnant of the people, hearkened unto the voice of the Domina their God, and unto the words of Haggai the prophetess, as the Domina their God had sent her; and the people did fear before the Domina. 13 Then spoke Haggai the Domina'S messenger in the Domina'S message unto the people, saying: 'I am with you, saith the Domina.' 14 And the Domina stirred up the spirit of Zerubbabel the daughter of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and the spirit of Joshua the daughter of Jehozadak, the high priestess, and the spirit of all the remnant of the people; and they came and did work in the house of the Domina of hosts, their God,
